thread.title: 96. In Case You Didn't Know - Brett Young
thread.title_full: 96. In Case You Didn't Know - Brett Young

title: 96. In Case You Didn't Know - Brett Young
text:
12 Songs Album Review 
California-bred singer/songwriter and former major-league pitching prospect Brett Young makes his debut for Republic Records with this self-titled EP. After several acoustic pop-oriented releases out West, Young made the move to Nashville and pushed his country side to the fore. Working with producer Dann Huff (Taylor Swift, Faith Hill), the smoky-voiced singer offers up six warm, romantic cuts that showcase his earthy charms. Led by the single "Sleep Without You," Young's EP showcases his down-to-earth, easygoing manner. Customer Reviews by Mr. LeviMoore Finally. Finally. Real country. Some of the pop country is good, because it sounds good, like I really like Sam Hunt, but I just can't stand bands like Old Dominion and their awful album. This album starts with the single 'Sleep Without You', which you're almost for sure going to like, because it's a likable song that's on the radio. I like the guitars on 'Like I Loved You' and how they do one note at a time on the chorus, and then the organs pop in on the verses. 'In Case You Didn't Know' is another song that you're probably going to like. Kinda sounds like the song that's on the radio. 'Left Side of Leavin'' is an upbeat song that should be on the radio. Biography Genre: Country A singer and songwriter whose music balances the sophistication of contemporary pop with the emotional palette of modern country, Brett Young was born and raised in Orange County, California, and was a teenager when he first developed a love for music by learning to play guitar. In the late '90s, Young was a student at Costa Mesa's Calvary Chapel High School, and he volunteered to help the school's worship leader with performances on Friday mornings. One Friday, the music leader was out of town,...   Brett Young 1.
